activity.name: Activity
activity.description: Activity events report actions that occur at devices and on the network.
activity.notes: Events that pertain to devices follow an actor -> action -> target model, which identifies a process (actor) that operated on an target object.

application.name: Application
application.description: Application Lifecycle events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.
application.notes:
Examples of Application Lifecycle events:
  • Application lifecycle such as installation, removal, update, start, and stop of an application or service
  • Users or services making configuration changes
  • Certificate or license expiration information

audit.name: Audit
audit.description: Audit events report user activity at management consoles.
audit.notes: User activity include users logging on or off management consoles and making configuration changes to managed entities.

alert.name: Security Alert
alert.description: Security Alert events report detections and possible resolutions of threats, anomalies, and other actions performed by security products.
alert.notes:
Threats and anomalies can be detected in any of the following ways:
  • By a manual or scheduled scan of a device
  • By monitoring a device for suspicious activity
  • By monitoring the network for suspicious activity

Possible threats and anomalies include:

  • Known viruses
  • Known malware
  • Suspicious file activity (AKA greyware)
  • Suspicious network activity
  • Suspicious resource activity
  • Suspicious email activity
Possible responses include:
  • Removing a file that contains one or more threats
  • Removing a registry key
  • Killing a process that contains a threat
  • Blocking network activity
  • Blocking or removing emails

diagnostic.name: Diagnostic
diagnostic.description: Diagnostic events report status, errors, and performance statistics of a service or application.

discovery.name: Discovery
discovery.description: Discovery events report the existence of devices, files, processes, registry keys, and other objects.

incident.name: Incident
incident.description: Incident events report the creation, update and closure of incidents.

remediation.name: Remediation
remediation.description: Remediation events report the results the remediation status of files, processes, registry keys, and other objects.
